items.text: there's the first of the game. Took em long enough! And it's a peach too. For half a second, it seems Hope is cramped up. As if he can't get a full swing of the bat through a ball on his hips. But he goes through with the pick-up shot and it lands well over the boundary at midwicket. Outstanding timing, really.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, SIX runs

items.text: back of a length and outside off, he steers it to point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: turns a stray on his pads to short fine leg
items.postText: Don : "Still reckon West Indies need at least 300..very possible if these two go deep"
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, 1 run

items.text: there's the cutter and it beats Holder. Good length ball pitches on leg stump and decks right across the defending right-hander
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, no run

items.text: pushes the fuller delivery on middle and off stump to cover
items.postText:
Puneet Gandhi: "Where is Universe boss?" --- #Chillin

Hasan: "Must be bit frustrating for players like Ambris, Carter and Campbell to know that no matter how well they perform here, they will almost for sure lose their place to Gayle, Hetmeyer etc."
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, no run

items.text: pitches it up on off stump, Hope wants to attack it, but he can't. There's no room on offer. And he ends up blocking to point
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run

items.text: this time he has the length to go after - short - but it cramps him on leg stump and though he makes room, he can only find point
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run

items.text: full and angled into middle stump, Hope defends
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run

items.text: hacks a good length ball on off stump away to the left of midwicket. Tension building and it shows on Hope. He wants a release shot.
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run

items.text: makes room and lashes a flatter delivery on middle stump to cover. Misfield there allows a single
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, 1 run

items.text: nudges a length ball on middle behind square leg
items.postText: Jack: "Its almost guaranteed that the WC pitches will be roads so it will be fascinating to see, a) which team fosters the best bowling strategy and b) which team will hold the highest total for the tournament. Might be at Nottingham given that 400-plus totals are the norm these days over there...."
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run

items.preText: Anon06: "@Hasan: How can they possibly even replace Gayle and Hetmyer? For sure one of them will replace Gayle after the WC. But I strongly feel that one of them should get in ahead of an out of form Lewis (and/or Bravo) for the WC. Carter however, is just not good enough. He should not even be in talks about having a place in the first XI."
items.text: ridiculously good slower ball. He needs to pull the length back, seeing Holder advance, and then put the cut on the ball to bear the leading edge as the batsman looks for midwicket because he has no other choice. The ball pitches outside leg stump. Instinct tells him to go against the cut and that's where the Fizz is so good. He makes them play against the cut all the time
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, no run
Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, 1 run

items.text: slogs across the line and even the full pace delivery is working for Mustafiz as Hope misses. Badly
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: launches it down the ground but there's protection out there, midwicket running around to his left
items.postText:
Amir: "@ Abdullah. Great players don't necessarily make good coaches "

James: "This does feel like a "fringe" West Indies team. Gayle, Hetmeyer, Pooran and Russell will add some firepower to the batting, and you can expect at least one genuine quick (Gabriel or Thomas) to add some bowling fire."
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, 2 runs

items.text: lovely placement, between point and third man. Hope spots the short and wide ball, moves across onto his back foot, reaches out and concentrates on hitting the gap
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: gets up onto his tippy-toes to punch a shortish delivery angled across him through point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, 1 run

items.text: slices a wide half-volley straight at cover and there's so much power on the shot he misfields
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, 1 run

items.text: steps out to launch a length ball outside off away to long-on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run

items.text: full and on middle stump, he drives inside out to long-off
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, 1 run

items.text: makes a little room to carve the good length ball on off stump to the left of cover
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run

items.text: goes back to punch a fullish delivery on off stump to long-on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, 1 run

items.text: slider, which Holder deals with well enough, staying leg side of the ball and punching it to long-on
items.postText: Dav L: "Where's Sobers?" --- Doff the hat to you, sir. Well done
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run

items.text: slower ball outside off. Holder thinks it's there to be smoked down the ground, but it dips at the last second and so he ends up dragging the ball along the ground to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, 2 runs

items.text: full and outside off, he slaps it to the left of cover and the right of the sweeper
items.postText: Sajib: "As much as I would like the great man to be a coach, I think Sachin is too nice and too great for that in general. But surely Bangladesh could benefit from a legend like him."
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, 2 runs
